inclusion.criterion: Consecutive patients were recruited for the study who presented to the Yonsei University Medical Center with variable symptom or cause for ERCP older than 20years.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients were excluded from study participation if they had a contraindication for diclofenac, including patients with recently diagnosed peptic ulcer disease or active/recent gastrointestinal hemorrhage within 4 weeks.
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Entry to the study was restricted to patients advised to have endoscopic retrograde cholangiography with or without pancreatography for extrahepatic cholestasis and/or impaired liver function tests.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The intramuscular route was selected on the basis of available small sized data suggesting that intramuscular NSAIDs are effective in preventing post-ERCP pancreatitis, perhaps owing to more rapid and complete bioavailability than with oral administration.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients were sedated with IV midazolam and IV continuous infusion of propofol under monitoring by anesthesiologist during whole time of procedure.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: they had a contraindication for diclofenac, including patients with recently diagnosed peptic ulcer disease or active/recent gastrointestinal hemorrhage within 4 weeks.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: those who had taken an NSAID during the preceding week (ASA 325 mg daily or less acceptable)
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient is a 41-year-old obese woman coming to the emergency room with abdominal pain and vomiting. She drinks alcohol frequently and does not smoke.
